item.text: Solomon began building the Lord’s temple in Jerusalem on Mount Moriah, where the Lord had appeared to his father David. This was the place that David prepared at the threshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite.
He began building on the second day of the second month of the fourth year of his reign.
Solomon laid the foundation for God’s temple; its length (determined according to the old standard of measure) was 90 feet, and its width 30 feet.

The <st data-num="0197 0834">porch</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">in</st> <st data-num="06440" class="">front</st> of the main hall was <st data-num="06242 0520">30 feet</st> <st data-num="0753" class="">long</st>, <st data-num="05921" class="">corresponding</st> <st data-num="06440" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="07341" class="">width</st> of the <st data-num="01004" class="">temple</st>,<n id="1" /> and its <st data-num="01363" class="">height</st> was <st data-num="06242 0520">30 feet</st>.<n id="2" /> He <st data-num="06823" class="">plated</st> the <st data-num="06441" class="">inside</st> with <st data-num="02889" class="">pure</st> <st data-num="02091" class="">gold</st>.

He <st data-num="02645" class="">paneled</st><n id="1" /> the <st data-num="01419" class="">main</st> <st data-num="01004" class="">hall</st><n id="2" /> with <st data-num="06086" class="">boards</st> made from <st data-num="01265" class="">evergreen trees</st><n id="3" /> and <st data-num="02645" class="">plated</st> it with <st data-num="02896" class="">fine</st> <st data-num="02091" class="">gold</st>, <st data-num="05927 05921">decorated</st> with <st data-num="08561" class="">palm trees</st> and <st data-num="08333" class="">chains</st>.<n id="4" />

He <st data-num="06823 08597">decorated</st> the <st data-num="01004" class="">temple</st> with <st data-num="03368" class="">precious</st> <st data-num="068" class="">stones</st>; the <st data-num="02091" class="">gold</st> he used <st data-num="02091" class="">came from</st> <st data-num="06516" class="">Parvaim</st>.<n id="1" />
He overlaid the temple’s rafters, thresholds, walls and doors with gold; he carved decorative cherubim on the walls.
He made the Most Holy Place; its length was 30 feet, corresponding to the width of the temple, and its width 30 feet. He plated it with 600 talents of fine gold.

The <st data-num="02091" class="">gold</st> <st data-num="04548" class="">nails</st> <st data-num="04948" class="">weighed</st> <st data-num="02572" class="">50</st> <st data-num="08255" class="">shekels</st>; he also <st data-num="02645" class="">plated</st> the <st data-num="05944" class="">upper areas</st> with <st data-num="02091" class="">gold</st>.

In the <st data-num="06944" class="">Most</st> <st data-num="06944" class="">Holy</st> <st data-num="01004" class="">Place</st> he <st data-num="06213" class="">made</st> <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> <st data-num="06816" class="">images</st> of <st data-num="03742" class="">cherubim</st> and <st data-num="06823" class="">plated</st> them with <st data-num="02091" class="">gold</st>.

The combined <st data-num="03671" class="">wing</st> <st data-num="0753" class="">span</st> of the <st data-num="03742" class="">cherubim</st> was <st data-num="06242 0520">30 feet</st>.<n id="1" /> <st data-num="0259" class="">One</st> of the first cherub’s <st data-num="03671" class="">wings</st> was <st data-num="02568 0520">7½</st> feet long and <st data-num="05060" class="">touched</st> one <st data-num="07023" class="">wall</st> of the <st data-num="01004" class="">temple</st>; its <st data-num="0312" class="">other</st> <st data-num="03671" class="">wing</st> was also <st data-num="02568 0520">7½</st> feet long and <st data-num="05060" class="">touched</st> one of the <st data-num="0312" class="">second</st> <st data-num="03742" class="">cherub’s</st> <st data-num="03671" class="">wings</st>.<n id="2" />

Likewise one of the <st data-num="0312" class="">second</st> <st data-num="03742" class="">cherub’s</st> <st data-num="03671" class="">wings</st> was <st data-num="02568 0520">7½</st> feet long and <st data-num="05060" class="">touched</st> the other <st data-num="07023" class="">wall</st> of the <st data-num="01004" class="">temple</st>; its <st data-num="0312" class="">other</st> <st data-num="03671" class="">wing</st> was also <st data-num="02568 0520">7½</st> feet long and <st data-num="01695" class="">touched</st> one of the <st data-num="0312" class="">first</st> <st data-num="03742" class="">cherub’s</st> <st data-num="03671" class="">wings</st>.<n id="1" />

The <st data-num="06566" class="">combined</st> <st data-num="03671" class="">wingspan</st> of <st data-num="0428" class="">these</st> <st data-num="03742" class="">cherubim</st> was <st data-num="06242 0520">30 feet</st>.<n id="1" /> <st data-num="01992" class="">They</st> <st data-num="05975" class="">stood</st> <st data-num="05921 07272">upright</st>, <st data-num="06440" class="">facing</st> <st data-num="01004" class="">inward</st>.<n id="2" />
He made the curtain out of blue, purple, crimson, and white fabrics, and embroidered on it decorative cherubim.
In front of the temple he made two pillars which had a combined length of 52½ feet, with each having a plated capital 7½ feet high.

He <st data-num="06213" class="">made</st> <st data-num="08333" class="">ornamental chains</st><n id="1" /> and <st data-num="05414" class="">put</st> them <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> <st data-num="07218" class="">top</st> of the <st data-num="05982" class="">pillars</st>. He also <st data-num="06213" class="">made</st> <st data-num="03967" class="">100</st> <st data-num="07416" class="">pomegranate-shaped ornaments</st> and <st data-num="05414" class="">arranged</st> them within the <st data-num="08333" class="">chains</st>.
He set up the pillars in front of the temple, one on the right side and the other on the left. He named the one on the right Yakin and the one on the left Boaz.
